refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The fs rmmount command removes the mount point named by the -dir argument from the file system. The corresponding volume remains on its host partition or partitions, but is inaccessible if there are no other mount points for it.

listitem.para: Names the mount point to delete from the file system. The last element in the pathname must be an actual name, not a shorthand notation such as "dot" (.) or "dot dot" (..).

Specify the read/write path to the directory, to avoid the failure that results from attempting to delete a mount point from a read-only volume. By convention, the read/write path is indicated by placing a period before the cell name at the pathname's second level (for example, /afs/.abc.com). For further discussion of the concept of read/write and read-only paths through the filespace, see the fs mkmount reference page.
Prints the online help for this command. All other valid options are ignored.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: The following command removes the mount points jones and terry from the current working directory (the /afs/abc.com/usr directory).

refsect1.title: Privilege Required
refsect1.para: The issuer must have the d (delete) permission on the ACL of the directory that houses each mount point.
